<a id="EditorSpinSlider"></a>

# EditorSpinSlider

**Inherits:** [Range](Range.md) **\<** [Control](Control.md) **\<** [CanvasItem](CanvasItem.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Redot editor's control for editing numeric values.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

This [Control](Control.md) node is used in the editor's Inspector dock to allow editing of numeric values. Can be used with [EditorInspectorPlugin](EditorInspectorPlugin.md) to recreate the same behavior.

If the [Range.step](Range.md#Range_property_step) value is ``1``, the **EditorSpinSlider** will display up/down arrows, similar to [SpinBox](SpinBox.md). If the [Range.step](Range.md#Range_property_step) value is not ``1``, a slider will be displayed instead.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="EditorSpinSlider_property_editing_integer"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **editing_integer** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#EditorSpinSlider_property_editing_integer)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_editing_integer**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_editing_integer**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the **EditorSpinSlider** is considered to be editing an integer value. If ``false``, the **EditorSpinSlider** is considered to be editing a floating-point value. This is used to determine whether a slider should be drawn. The slider is only drawn for floats; integers use up-down arrows similar to [SpinBox](SpinBox.md) instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorSpinSlider_property_flat"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **flat** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#EditorSpinSlider_property_flat)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_flat**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_flat**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the slider will not draw background.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorSpinSlider_property_hide_slider"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **hide_slider** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#EditorSpinSlider_property_hide_slider)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_hide_slider**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_hiding_slider**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the slider and up/down arrows are hidden.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorSpinSlider_property_label"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **label** = `""` [ðŸ”—](#EditorSpinSlider_property_label)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_label**\ (\ value\: [String](String.md)\ )
- [String](String.md) **get_label**\ (\ )

The text that displays to the left of the value.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorSpinSlider_property_read_only"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **read_only** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#EditorSpinSlider_property_read_only)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_read_only**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_read_only**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the slider can't be interacted with.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorSpinSlider_property_suffix"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **suffix** = `""` [ðŸ”—](#EditorSpinSlider_property_suffix)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_suffix**\ (\ value\: [String](String.md)\ )
- [String](String.md) **get_suffix**\ (\ )

The suffix to display after the value (in a faded color). This should generally be a plural word. You may have to use an abbreviation if the suffix is too long to be displayed.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

## Theme Property Descriptions

<a id="EditorSpinSlider_theme_icon_updown"></a>

<!-- classref-themeproperty -->

[Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **updown** [ðŸ”—](#EditorSpinSlider_theme_icon_updown)

Single texture representing both the up and down buttons.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorSpinSlider_theme_icon_updown_disabled"></a>

<!-- classref-themeproperty -->

[Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **updown_disabled** [ðŸ”—](#EditorSpinSlider_theme_icon_updown_disabled)

Single texture representing both the up and down buttons, when the control is readonly or disabled.
